001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.slf4j.spi;
002
003import org.slf4j.Logger;
004
005import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
006import io.jstach.rainbowgum.RainbowGum;
007import io.jstach.rainbowgum.slf4j.ForwardingLogger;
008import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider;
009
010/**
011 * <strong>EXPERIMENTAL:</strong> this rainbowgum service provider allows wrapping slf4j
012 * loggers created from the logger factory. <em>This allows for custom filtering using the
013 * SLF4J api directly!</em>
014 * <p>
015 * If there are multiple registrations {@link #order()} and then {@link #name()} will be
016 * used to sort where the lower order number and name will
017 * {@linkplain #decorate(RainbowGum, Logger) decorate} first. See
018 * {@link RainbowGumServiceProvider} for details on how to register.
019 * <p>
020 * <strong>IMPORTANT implementation detail</strong> is that you should not call the SLF4J
021 * logger factory otherwise a stackoverflow or similar will happen.
022 *
023 * @see ForwardingLogger
024 * @see RainbowGumServiceProvider
025 */
026public abstract class LoggerDecoratorService implements RainbowGumServiceProvider.Configurator {
027
028        /**
029         * No arg constructor for service loader.
030         */
031        public LoggerDecoratorService() {
032
033        }
034
035        @Override
036        public final boolean configure(LogConfig config) {
037                config.serviceRegistry().put(LoggerDecoratorService.class, this, name());
038                return true;
039        }
040
041        /**
042         * The name of the decorator and should be unique to avoid collisions.
043         * @return name.
044         */
045        public abstract String name();
046
047        /**
048         * Lowest integer value will decorate first which means the highest order found
049         * actually has the strongest influence on filtering since its returned logger is the
050         * one used.
051         * @return order.
052         */
053        public int order() {
054                return 0;
055        }
056
057        /**
058         * Decorate a logger. To not decorate simply return the previous logger.
059         * @param rainbowGum rainbow gum passed to the slf4j factory.
060         * @param previousLogger the previous logger in the chain.
061         * @return decorated logger.
062         */
063        public abstract Logger decorate(RainbowGum rainbowGum, Logger previousLogger);
064
065}
